meanings.definition: a type of millet grown in Africa and Asia for its edible seeds.
meanings.sent1: Farmers in Africa and Asia cultivate dhurras for their nutritious seeds.
meanings.sent2: The dhurras fields in Africa and Asia yield a bountiful harvest each year.
meanings.sent3: The playful monkeys in Africa and Asia enjoy stealing dhurras from the fields.
meanings.sent4: The dhurras plants sway gently in the breeze, like a golden sea.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly cooked dhurras fills the air, tempting all who pass by.

meanings.sent1: In the market, vendors sell bags of dhurras to customers.
meanings.sent2: The farmers gathered sacks of dhurras to store for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played a game of tossing dhurras at each other.
meanings.sent4: The dhurras piled up in the storage shed, forming a mountain of grains.
meanings.sent5: The sound of dhurras pouring into the containers was music to the ears of the workers.
